"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents provide information on anterior open bite, its causes, and treatment options. The Advanced periodontal disease and development of anterior open bite case report suggests that advanced periodontal disease can cause the development of an anterior open bite. However, there is no mention of fractures or breaks in the maxilla, mandible, or coronoid process as a direct cause of true open bite.

The Orthognathic surgery for the treatment of chronic self-mutilation of the lips article mentions orthognathic surgery to create an anterior open bite as a treatment option. This suggests that anterior open bite can be caused by underlying skeletal issues rather than fractures or breaks.

The Mioconverter and Sagittal osteotomy of the mandibular horizontal ramus articles discuss various treatment options for anterior open bite, including appliances and surgical interventions. Again, there is no mention of fractures or breaks as a cause of true open bite.
